CatDescriptText: Henry Griggs, 72 Steuben Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1958, pg. 1A with question: "Do you think that the average family spends too much time watching television programs? If so, how has it affected family life?" answer reads: "According to the kind of TV programs which the kids see, and I'm talking about crime and Wstern [sic] movies, television is no good for them.  However, it is all right for adults."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Henry Griggs wearing hat with stripe, eyeglasses, light colored shirt, diamond patterned necktie, jacket, and dark coat with pen in left breast pocket, standing in front of light colored textured stone wall
